name: Ananda Temple

description.short: One of the finest, largest, best preserved and most revered of the Bagan temples.
description.long: The Ananda Temple is a Buddhist temple located in Bagan, Myanmar. Built in 1105 AD during the reign of King Kyanzittha of the Pagan Dynasty, it is one of four surviving temples in Bagan. The temple layout is cruciform with several terraces leading to a small pagoda at the top covered by an umbrella known as hti, which is the name of the umbrella-like structure found on top of pagodas in Myanmar.

religious.significance: One of the most revered temples in Bagan

nameMm: အာနန္ဒာဘုရား

name: Dhammayangyi Temple

description.short: The largest of all the temples in Bagan, known for its impressive brickwork.
description.long: Dhammayangyi Temple is a Buddhist temple located in Bagan, Myanmar. Largest of all the temples in Bagan, the Dhammayangyi is built in a plan similar to that of Ananda Temple. The temple was built during the reign of King Narathu (1167-1170). Narathu, who came to the throne by assassinating his father Alaungsithu and his brother, built this largest temple to atone for his sins.

nameMm: ဓမ္မရံကြီးဘုရား
shortNameMm: ဓမ္မရံကြီး

description.short: A Buddhist temple built during the reign of King Anawrahta and completed by King Kyansittha.
description.long: The Shwezigon Pagoda is a Buddhist stupa located in Nyaung-U, a town near Bagan in Myanmar. A prototype of Burmese stupas, it consists of a circular gold leaf-gilded stupa surrounded by smaller temples and shrines. Construction of the pagoda began during the reign of King Anawrahta (1044–1077), the founder of the Pagan Empire, in 1059–1060 and was completed in 1102, during the reign of his son King Kyansittha.

name: Sulamani Temple

description.short: Built in 1183 by King Narapatisithu, featuring beautiful murals and architecture.
description.long: Sulamani Temple is a Buddhist temple located in the Bagan Archaeological Zone in Myanmar. Built in 1183 by King Narapatisithu, Sulamani Temple is one of the most visited temples in Bagan. The temple is known for its beautiful frescoes and architectural details.

nameMm: စူဠာမဏိဘုရား

name: Thatbyinnyu Temple

description.short: The tallest temple in Bagan, standing at 61 meters high.
description.long: Thatbyinnyu Temple is a Buddhist temple in Bagan, Myanmar. It is the tallest temple in Bagan, standing at 61 meters (200 feet). The temple was built in the mid-12th century during the reign of King Alaungsithu. The name means 'omniscience' in reference to the Buddha's all-seeing knowledge.

nameMm: သဗ္ဗညုဘုရား

name: Gawdawpalin Temple

description.short: One of the largest and most impressive temples in Bagan, built in the 12th century.
description.long: Gawdawpalin Temple is one of the largest and most impressive temples in Bagan, Myanmar. Built in the late 12th century during the reign of King Narapatisithu, the temple is known for its imposing structure and beautiful architecture.

nameMm: ဂေါဝါပလင်ဘုရား

description.short: Built in 1218 by King Htilominlo, known for its fine plaster carvings and glazed sandstone decorations.
description.long: Htilominlo Temple is a Buddhist temple located in Bagan, Myanmar, built in 1218 during the reign of King Htilominlo (Nandaungmya). The temple is known for its fine plaster carvings and glazed sandstone decorations. It represents the last of the great temple building periods in Bagan.

religious.significance: Last great temple of Bagan period

description.short: An ancient pagoda built in 1137 AD, known for its unique architectural style and historical significance.
description.long: Alodawpyae Pagoda, also known as Alo Daw Pyi Pagoda, is an ancient Buddhist pagoda located in Bagan, Myanmar. Built in 1137 AD during the Pagan period, it represents the early architectural style of Bagan pagodas with its distinctive bell-shaped structure.

description.short: Built in 1059 by the captive Mon King Manuha, featuring three seated and one reclining Buddha.
description.long: Manuha Temple was built in 1059 by King Manuha, the captive Mon king from Thaton. The temple is famous for its cramped interior space containing three seated Buddha images and one reclining Buddha, symbolizing the king's suffering in captivity.

description.short: Built by King Anawrahta in 1059, strategically located by the Irrawaddy River for sunset views.
description.long: Lawkananda Pagoda was built in 1059 by King Anawrahta, the founder of the Pagan Empire. Located on the banks of the Irrawaddy River, it offers spectacular sunset views and was strategically positioned to guard the river approach to Bagan.

description.short: A 13th-century temple known for its well-preserved murals and traditional Bagan architecture.
description.long: Thambula Temple is a Buddhist temple built in the 13th century during the late Pagan period. The temple is renowned for its well-preserved interior murals depicting Buddhist Jataka tales and traditional Bagan architectural features.

description.short: A unique pagoda built in the 11th century, featuring distinctive architectural elements and peaceful surroundings.
description.long: Iza Gawna Pagoda, also known as Shin Izza Gawna Temple, is a Buddhist pagoda built in the 11th century. It features unique architectural elements that distinguish it from other Bagan monuments and is surrounded by peaceful rural landscapes.

name: BuPaya Pagoda

description.short: One of the oldest pagodas in Bagan, built in the 3rd century, offering stunning river views.
description.long: BuPaya Pagoda is believed to be one of the oldest pagodas in Bagan, traditionally dated to the 3rd century. Located on the banks of the Irrawaddy River, it offers spectacular views and is said to have been built to ward off evil spirits.

nameMm: ဗုပါးဘုရား

description.short: A 13th-century temple known for its impressive size and well-preserved structure.
description.long: Pyathetgyi Temple, also known as Pyathadar Temple, is a Buddhist temple built in the 13th century during the late Pagan period. The temple is notable for its impressive size and well-preserved architectural features.

description.short: Built in 1113, famous for its exceptional murals depicting Buddhist Jataka tales.
description.long: Gu Byauk Gyi Temple was built in 1113 during the reign of King Kyanzittha. The temple is renowned for its exceptional interior murals that depict Buddhist Jataka tales and represent some of the finest examples of Pagan period art.

description.short: Twin pagodas built in the 11th century, known for their elegant architecture and historical significance.
description.long: Sein Nyet NyiAma Gu Phaya consists of twin pagodas built in the 11th century. The pagodas are known for their elegant architecture and historical significance in the Bagan region. The larger pagoda stands at 50 feet tall, while the smaller one is 35 feet tall.

description.short: A historic temple built in the 12th century, known for its elegant proportions and fine brickwork.
description.long: Shwe Gu Gyi Temple is a Buddhist temple in Bagan, Myanmar. Built in 1131 AD during the reign of King Alaungsithu, it is considered one of the finest examples of middle-period Bagan architecture. The temple features a single-story structure with elegant proportions and intricate brickwork.

description.short: A significant pagoda built in the 16th century, known for its historical importance and golden spire.
description.long: Mahazedi Pagoda is a Buddhist pagoda located in Bagan, Myanmar. Originally built in the 16th century during the reign of King Bayinnaung, it was reconstructed after earthquake damage. The pagoda is historically significant as it once enshrined a replica of the Buddha's tooth relic.

religious.significance: Housed replica of Buddha's tooth relic

description.short: A unique pentagonal pagoda built in 1196, featuring five Buddha images.
description.long: Dhammayazaka Pagoda is a Buddhist pagoda located in Bagan, Myanmar. Built in 1196 during the reign of King Narapatisithu, it is unique for its pentagonal design which features five shrines, each housing a Buddha image representing the four Buddhas of the current kalpa and the future Buddha Maitreya.
